actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to promote and assist in the development of the private sector, including small and medium-sized businesses, in Central and Eastern Europe through an export enhancement regime that will enourage direct private investment in such countries.
short_title: Central and Eastern Europe Investment and Export Enhancement Act of 1990

summary.text: Central and Eastern Europe Investment and Export Enhancement Act of 1990 - Amends the Export Administration Act of 1979 to direct the President to take the following steps to implement investment and export enhancement for Central and Eastern European countries that have made transitions from Communist governments to democracies and that are protecting against the diversion of Western technology: (1) instruct the Secretary of State to seek the approval of the Coordinating Committee on Multilateral Export Controls for the removal of controls on goods to countries meeting specified criteria (provided that such goods do not exceed the level at which exports to China require Committee notification); (2) instruct the Secretaries of State, Defense, and Commerce to implement such level of control; (3) instruct the U.S. Customs Service to initiate the negotiation of government-to-government Customs Memoranda of Understanding with countries meeting such criteria; and (4) instruct the Secretary of State to initiate negotiations with such Central and Eastern European countries to conclude bilateral technology transfer safeguard agreements.

titles.title: Central and Eastern Europe Investment and Export Enhancement Act of 1990

A bill to promote and assist in the development of the private sector, including small and medium-sized businesses, in Central and Eastern Europe through an export enhancement regime that will enourage direct private investment in such countries.
